file_content.text: [The warfare prototypes are hidden inside this unlocked containment vault.]
That should stop any prisoners from getting their hands on these weapons.
[Seal the vault.]
Thanks, I know some prisoners who would do a lot of damage with those things.
I never really believed the stories about Jedi, until now.
I still need to get to the research vault and rescue Doctor Gantrell.
My work isn't done yet.
We Jedi seek to let the Force work through us. And the Force is a powerful ally.
I am a servant of the light.
I don't know what that means, but it sounds good.
I couldn't ignore this; it would go against the Jedi Code.
I just did my duty.
I think you just went above and beyond any code.
I don't have comm access to the lower levels. You'll be on your own.
Good luck, Jedi. We're all counting on you.
I need to think about this.
[Do nothing for now.]
Some of this equipment could come in handy.
[Loot the vault.]
Wait a minute! What do you think you're doing?
You know what I'm up against. I need all the help I can get.
I need this for my mission.
The prisoners shouldn't get their hands on these prototypes, right? Best if I take them.
I'll keep this stuff safe.
Don't give me that. I know a thief when I see one!
I don't like people looking over my shoulder.
Are you spying on me?
I was monitoring in case you needed help. I didn't realize you're a thief!
I've stolen plenty--even killed for things--but I expected better from a Jedi!
A guard who's committed theft and murder? Which side of the cell door is he on?
Hang on. He's supposed to be a guard.
That explains it. He isn't a guard. He's a prisoner.
The Republic doesn't hire criminals as prison guards. That man isn't who he says.
T7 = confused // Pak = guard or prisoner?
I want the truth. Are you one of the inmates?
Time to come clean, Pak.
You're supposed to always do what's right. You're not supposed to be like the rest of us!
I don't care about your personal issues, Pak. I need to find Executor Krannus.
We don't have time for this.
You're as greedy as I ever was. Go then, you dirty thief!
What are you talking about? Were you one of the inmates here?
You weren't always a guard?
I'm a Jedi. You're a lousy prison guard... assuming that's even true.
How dare you judge me!
I came here a decade ago as a prisoner. Being on Belsavis--surrounded by scum just like me--it opened my eyes.
I decided to change. Took a lot of years, but I finally did it.
A few months ago, the warden made me an honorary guard. Gave me a second chance.
Why should I fall for a story like that?
I don't believe you.
You worked hard to turn your life around, Pak. You deserved to be rewarded.
Sounds like you earned it.
I thought being a guard meant I'd work with good people. You're as greedy as I ever was.
I looked up to you. Now you make me sick.
The warden made a mistake. Sooner or later, you'll go back to being a criminal.
People don't change.
I don't care what you think! You're a dirty hypocrite!
Just do a better job saving Doctor Gantrell than you did here!
